page.title: 06Cows Trample Mother
page.content: Mrs Katrina Hodkin was walking along a well defined footpath on 30 June 1985 with 9 year old Elizabeth Watters and Alexander, Mrs Hodkin's 9 year old son. They had a dog with them that was properly leashed. About 18 cows surrounded the party one of which knocked Mrs Hodkin to the ground. She tried to get up but was again knocked down and trampled on. In the meantime an identical thing happened to Elizabeth. Alexander had managed to escape to the boundary fence. Both Mrs Hodkin and Elizabeth were badly cut and bruised and needed medical attention. During the incident Mrs Hodkin had wondered whether she would get away with her life! The beasts were Hereford cross Fresian cows with Charolais cross calves. The local farmer blamed the presence of the dog for the incident.
